-1.title: Walk-in Business and Buying a Turntable
-1.plot: Walk-in sellers and buyers are rare at Legendary Motorcar nowadays, so when a nice 71 Boss 351 pulls into the shop, an unexpected deal may be happening. Sick of taking pictures of cars for the LMC website, Gary has a creative idea.

1.title: All Original Ferrari 275
1.plot: Peter has been chasing the owner of a 1967 Ferrari 275 GTB 4 cam for 7 years trying to buy this car. When the owner finally decides to sell the car and it arrives at Legendary, even Pete is shocked by how original this car is.

2.title: The Thunderbolt
2.plot: Peter receives a call about an original Thunderbolt drag car that is sitting in the LMC showroom. The caller claims he is too busy to come look at the car but asks if Pete can haul it down to a drag strip where he is running his nitro methane funny car.

3.title: The Legendary Bullitt
3.plot: A client of Peter's wants his Mustang turned into an identical version of the famous Steve McQueen car in the Bullitt movie.

4.title: A Barn Find Boss Gets a New Life
4.plot: Peter hears about a crusty old timer who lives just outside of town that has quite the collection of rusting hulks sitting in his back yard. One of them is rumoured to be a Boss 429. Gary and Pete decide they must head down and see if the car is all that.

5.title: The Supercuda
5.plot: If guys at Legendary Motorcar were challenged to take an American muscle car and turn it into and Enzo killer, would they be up for the challenge? And if so, where would they start? How about taking the body of 1970 Cuda and dropping it onto a twin turbo.

6.title: A Shoe Fit for a Car
6.plot: Peter receives a phone call from a guy who is angry that Peter's footwear does not adequately reflect the level of respect that some of the world's finest cars demand. Really, is this guy serious?

7.title: A Rare Desert Find
7.plot: Pete and Gary head to Phoenix looking for cars. After a couple of misses they find an owner of one of the very rare, completely original GT40 street cars. Peter feels this car is ready to explode but the owner knows exactly what he has. This won't be easy.

8.title: A Shelby Surprise
8.plot: When a 68 Shelby arrives at LMC and starts into its restoration process no one seems impressed, Legendary has done a million of these things. But as the car comes apart the guys in the shop start to think they may have something very special on their hands.

9.title: Toy Trains and Real Cars
9.plot: A friend of a friend wants to unload a few cars. One of them is a 66 Chevelle in which Pete definitely has some interest. The seller also asks Pete if he can take a few other collector items. Does Pete want the Chevelle bad enough to buy 4000 toy trains?

10.title: Selling a Caddy in the Carolinas
10.plot: Peter has a very nice 55 Cadillac that he is taking to the Greensboro Auto Auction. To make the trip worthwhile, he has to send the hauler back to LMC loaded with new cars. Between the auction and a potential seller, its going to be a busy weekend.

11.title: Jessica's Healy
11.plot: When a collector decides to call LMC to sell a Healy, Peter is not very excited. But when he goes to look at the car he is surprised by the owner and her collection. The blond hair, the tattoos, and one more thing...the genuine Egyptian mummy.

12.title: Closing Deals and Cleaning Floors
12.plot: Gary is working the front desk at Legendary Motorcar one Saturday when a call comes in about a 1940 Dodge pickup. Could leaving money on the table with this buyer lead to a bigger deal on a Ford GT?

13.title: A Brotherly Deal
13.plot: As spring time finally sets in, Pete gets a surprise visit from his brother. Dave Klutt has the itch to buy a sports car. When he can't decide between a ZR1 Corvette and an ACR Viper Pete decides to let him try both at a track day.

14.title: A Rookie Buyer and a Superbird
14.plot: An old contact calls Pete to let him know about a friend who is looking to unload a couple of cars. One is a 66 Chevelle in which Pete definitely has interest. As the deal wraps up the seller asks Pete if he can take a few other items off his hands.

15.title: Race Shop and a GTX Resto Mod
15.plot: LMC has a client that wants to build a replica of the iconic 68 Mustang GT as seen Bullit. The chase is on for a donor car and a timeline that suits LMC and the owner. Peter takes a serious car guy with a medical condition for a ride in a rare supercar.

1.title: Who's the Boss
1.plot: Last season Peter was excited to buy a Boss 429 from a crusty old timer, and was even more excited when a good client not only buys the car, but also agrees to a full restoration. The problem is, the old man assured Peter that "all the parts are there". They're there alright, including the cracked block and the cracked heads.

2.title: Cobra Charmer
2.plot: Gary is super excited when he gets a chance to have a look at a very original 63 Cobra. The owner makes it very clear that he does not want to sell the car so Gary's trip is all about collecting information. But after a period of time the owner calls and says he may be in the mood.

3.title: Kuwait for Me!
3.plot: Pete and Gary get invited to the Kuwait Concours D'Elegance in Kuwait City. Yes, the one in the Middle East. So they prepare and ship a 1919 Pierce Arrow over and board a plane wondering what to expect from a part of the world that neither of them has visited before.

4.title: A Ford GT and Me
4.plot: Ford GTs are hot. So when two separate customers walk into LMC and both guys want one, Pete and Gary are happy. But instead of buying the cars, both guys want to do some sort of trade. Let the bargaining begin.

5.title: Datsun Nice Car You Got There
5.plot: Gary loves original cars, so when he hears about a motivated seller of an 82 Datsun 280Z he hooks up the trailer and heads out. But is an all original 280Z really a collectable car?

6.title: Barrett-Jackson Rookies
6.plot: Peter and Gary take a 1919 Pierce Arrow the Barrett Jackson auction in Scottsdale with the hope of seeing the car bring a good number. They are also hoping to do some buying. But when Gary gets ushered offstage by security while Peter is away trying to get the Pierce started, the whole weekend is put in jeopardy.

7.title: Split on the Split Window
7.plot: Pete gets a call from one of his spotters informing him of a very original 68 split window Corvette. There is no time to get there in person, so Pete walks his spotter through the deal. When the car arrives at Legendary, Peter and Gary disagree on what to do with this car.

8.title: Finding the Fiberglass Ferrari
8.plot: When Peter sends Gary to look at Ferrari 308 they are assuming it's a regular car. But as Gary digs into the car some questions start to arise. Is this one of the fiberglass bodied 308s? And if so, whats it worth compared to a steel bodied 308?

9.title: Don't Ferrari Me Around
9.plot: As race car values start to climb, Peter finds himself holding a Ferrari 206 SP. The biggest question about this car is, despite a fire, is this car actually original? He brings in the Swiss Ferrari expert Marcel Massini to perform an detailed evaluation.

10.title: Dealing for Cup Cars
10.plot: As the value of race cars starts to climb Peter decides to start hunting for some NASCAR race cars with good stories and good histories. Where could he find such cars? The Hendricks Motorsports shop in Charlotte would be a fabulous start.

11.title: Peter and Gary are California Dreamin'
11.plot: When really good cars are available to be bought Peter and Gary will go just about anywhere to find them. So when they hear about a 300SL Mercedes and a very rare 59 Ferrari 250 GT in California they hit the road.

12.title: Chi-town Cuda
12.plot: When Peter gets a chance to buy a rare Hemi Cuda convertible he can't help but jump on the car. When he gets the chance to make the car look better than it ever, he has to get to work because the only place to really show this car off is at the greatest muscle car show in the world, the Muscle Car and Corvette Nationals show in Chicago.

1.title: Restoring a 40 for Its 50th
1.plot: With a beautiful Gulf liveried, original, street legal GT 40 sitting in the shop, Peter and the guys have some decisions to make about this car. Hold? Sell? Auction? Restore? Let's go with all of the above.

2.title: West Coast Car Hunting
2.plot: When Tim, a contact of LMC's, asks Peter to come car hunting in the city of Victoria on Western Canada's Vancouver Island, the trip turns out much more frustrating than expected.

3.title: Head to Head GT-350's
3.plot: Peter negotiatef to score a "near perfect" GT350. Gary buys a GT350 on a hunch. Let the head to head comparison and trash talking begin.

4.title: Trading Up to a Cobra
4.plot: When a guy pulls into LMC in an original, very nice LS6 corvette, Gary discovers the guy is looking to trade up to a 289 Cobra. Crusty old-timer sells Gary an old race Mini for $5K, but is this a good investment or a costly mistake?

5.title: The Lady Wants Her Vette, and Mr Shelby's Cobra
5.plot: When a couple from Boston make the nine-hour drive to Legendary to see a Corvette they've been watching on the LMC website, the deal won't come as easily as they expected. Peter buys Caroll Shelby's 427 Cobra but it definitely needs work.

6.title: A Ferrari Deal and $5000 Risk on Mini
6.plot: Peter finds a guy who has a great Ferrari 512BB in his small backyard shed. He wants to sell it but believes it to be worth the prices he sees on TV. Pete might have some explaining to do.

7.title: Racked and Stacked Cars in Calgary
7.plot: While Peter is doing a deal with a long time customer, he doesn't realize he is also being roped into attending a charity event at the customer's collection in Calgary. But, he also scores a free day at a brand new race track.

8.title: A Perfect Spyder Goes to Florida
8.plot: When Peter and Gary find an Ferrari Daytona Spyder they know they have to get this car to Cavallino. While Peter is gone, Gary has a customer come into LMC who'd like to trade his Ferrari in for a Camaro. That's right, a Ferrari for a Camaro.

9.title: An Adventure in Indy
9.plot: Peter has a weekend of racing planned with Al Unser, Jr. at Indy, and checks out a resto project on the way to the track. When he arrives, Pete isn't sure if he should be more excited about racing with Al or taking possession of an Aston Martin Vulcan.

10.title: The Auto Show Sells a Ferrari
10.plot: Gary reps LM at the Toronto Auto Show on his own, and when a buyer asks about a Challenge Stradale Ferrari in the showroom, Peter is surprised to find that being on social media and attending events really pays off.

11.title: Is a Cougar a Classic
11.plot: Peter has a customer looking for a Cougar XR7. But when the customer comes in to see the car, a nicely restored BMW Isetta catches his eye, too. Gary also thanks his race sponsors from last season with a thrilling trip to a local stunt driving school.

12.title: A Very Welcome Surprise
12.plot: Peter has had a beautiful 59 race built corvette sitting at LMC for a few months when the original restorer calls him to offer up a couple of big surprises.

imdb.plot outline: Legendary Motorcars returns as the team takes on the dramatic restorations, appraisals, and sales of high-end and exotic vehicles. This season Pete and Gary take a trip to Kuwait to attend the Concours D'Elegance, but are also eager to talk to the average car guy to learn the similarities between the West and the Middle East.
imdb.title: Legendary Motorcars
plot: _Legendary Motorcars_ (qv) returns as the team takes on the dramatic restorations, appraisals, and sales of high-end and exotic vehicles. This season Pete and Gary take a trip to Kuwait to attend the Concours D'Elegance, but are also eager to talk to the average car guy to learn the similarities between the West and the Middle East.
